headline: Is IMAX’s Record Holiday Box Office And Fan-Led Re-Releases Altering The Investment Case For IMAX (IMAX)?
summary: IMAX recently set a new Thanksgiving box office record, generating US$40.8 million globally from family-focused hits like Disney’s Zootopia 2 and Universal’s Wicked: For Good, while also opening advance bookings for Avatar: Fire and Ash and running a fan-driven campaign to select past films for large-format re-releases. By pairing record holiday takings with interactive fan polling on which movies return to its premium screens, IMAX is sharpening its focus on audience engagement and the...

headline: Warner Bros. Begins Exclusive Deal Talks With Netflix
summary: Netflix is offering a $5 billion breakup fee if regulators don’t approve the deal, said the people, who asked to not be identified because the discussions are private.  The move suggests Netflix has pulled ahead of Paramount Skydance Corp. and Comcast Corp., who were also competing for the asset.  Prior to the closing of the sale, Warner Bros. — valued at more than $60 billion overall — will complete the planned spinoff of cable channels including CNN, TBS and TNT.

content.title: Warner Bros. Begins Exclusive Deal Talks With Netflix
content.summary: Netflix is offering a $5 billion breakup fee if regulators don’t approve the deal, said the people, who asked to not be identified because the discussions are private.  The move suggests Netflix has pulled ahead of Paramount Skydance Corp. and Comcast Corp., who were also competing for the asset.  Prior to the closing of the sale, Warner Bros. — valued at more than $60 billion overall — will complete the planned spinoff of cable channels including CNN, TBS and TNT.

headline: The Week in Numbers: Thanksgiving sales surge, Disney's China record
summary:
STORY: From a Thanksgiving holiday sales surge to a Disney film breaking Chinese records...

This is the Week in Numbers.

:: Week in Numbers

:: $44 billion

$44 billion was how much U.S. shoppers spent online over the Thanksgiving weekend.

Consumers bought up during the five-days from Thanksgiving to Cyber Monday as retail giants like Amazon and Walmart rolled out discounts.

The data came from an Adobe Analytics report.

It showed spending was up 7.7% from a year earlier and beat Adobe's forecast.

:: 10% 

10% is how much Boeing shares jumped after a positive report.

Investors bought in after the planemaker said it expects higher jet deliveries and positive free cash flow next year.

Boeing wants to improve its image after a 5-year corporate crisis involving safety and production issues of its 737 series.

The issues have hit its reputation and sent the U.S. major deeply into debt

:: $1.5 billion

$1.5 billion is how much Prada spent to buy out fellow Italian fashion brand Versace.

Prada had long sought the deal and signed an agreement in April to purchase the decades-old firm from U.S.-based Capri Holdings.

The late Gianni Versace founded his luxury brand known for its glamorous style in 1978.

His sister Donatella stepped down as creative head earlier this year.

:: 10.6%

10.6% was the sales growth rise for Zara owner Inditex in November.

It's a crucial period for retailers due to the Black Friday weekend.

It also confirmed a strong start to the fashion major's biggest revenue quarter.

One analyst said the Spanish company may have its home market to thank due to the country's strong economy.

:: $275.6 million

And $275.6 million was how much Disney's Zootopia 2 made in its first six days of release in China.

That means it has become the highest-grossing animated foreign film ever in the country.

Zootopia 2 made up around 95% of all movie ticket sales over its opening weekend.

It comes just months after Beijing cut the number of U.S. films allowed in China due to its trade war with Washington.

STORY: From a Thanksgiving holiday sales surge to a Disney film breaking Chinese records...

This is the Week in Numbers.

:: Week in Numbers

:: $44 billion

$44 billion was how much U.S. shoppers spent online over the Thanksgiving weekend.

Consumers bought up during the five-days from Thanksgiving to Cyber Monday as retail giants like Amazon and Walmart rolled out discounts.

The data came from an Adobe Analytics report.

It showed spending was up 7.7% from a year earlier and beat Adobe's forecast.

:: 10% 

10% is how much Boeing shares jumped after a positive report.

Investors bought in after the planemaker said it expects higher jet deliveries and positive free cash flow next year.

Boeing wants to improve its image after a 5-year corporate crisis involving safety and production issues of its 737 series.

The issues have hit its reputation and sent the U.S. major deeply into debt

:: $1.5 billion

$1.5 billion is how much Prada spent to buy out fellow Italian fashion brand Versace.

Prada had long sought the deal and signed an agreement in April to purchase the decades-old firm from U.S.-based Capri Holdings.

The late Gianni Versace founded his luxury brand known for its glamorous style in 1978.

His sister Donatella stepped down as creative head earlier this year.

:: 10.6%

10.6% was the sales growth rise for Zara owner Inditex in November.

It's a crucial period for retailers due to the Black Friday weekend.

It also confirmed a strong start to the fashion major's biggest revenue quarter.

One analyst said the Spanish company may have its home market to thank due to the country's strong economy.

:: $275.6 million

And $275.6 million was how much Disney's Zootopia 2 made in its first six days of release in China.

That means it has become the highest-grossing animated foreign film ever in the country.

It comes just months after Beijing cut the number of U.S. films allowed in China due to its trade war with Washington.

headline: Netflix to buy Warner Bros Discovery's studios, streaming unit for $72 billion
summary: Netflix has agreed to buy Warner Bros Discovery's TV and film studios and streaming division for $72 billion, a deal that would hand control of one of Hollywood's most prized and oldest assets to ​the streaming pioneer that has upended the media industry.  The agreement - announced on Friday - follows a weeks-long bidding war where ‌Netflix seized the lead with a nearly $28-a-share offer that eclipsed Paramount Skydance's nearly $24 bid for the whole of Warner Bros Discovery, including the cable TV assets ‌slated for a spinoff.  Buying the owner of marquee franchises including "Game of Thrones", "DC Comics" and "Harry Potter" will further tilt the power balance in Hollywood in favor of the streaming giant that built its dominance without major acquisitions or a large content library, helping its efforts to ward off competition ⁠from Walt Disney and the Ellison family-backed Paramount.

content.title: Netflix to buy Warner Bros Discovery's studios, streaming unit for $72 billion
content.summary: Netflix has agreed to buy Warner Bros Discovery's TV and film studios and streaming division for $72 billion, a deal that would hand control of one of Hollywood's most prized and oldest assets to ​the streaming pioneer that has upended the media industry.  The agreement - announced on Friday - follows a weeks-long bidding war where ‌Netflix seized the lead with a nearly $28-a-share offer that eclipsed Paramount Skydance's nearly $24 bid for the whole of Warner Bros Discovery, including the cable TV assets ‌slated for a spinoff.  Buying the owner of marquee franchises including "Game of Thrones", "DC Comics" and "Harry Potter" will further tilt the power balance in Hollywood in favor of the streaming giant that built its dominance without major acquisitions or a large content library, helping its efforts to ward off competition ⁠from Walt Disney and the Ellison family-backed Paramount.

headline: Netflix to buy Warner Bros. Discovery in deal of the decade
summary: Streaming giant Netflix said Friday it will buy film and television studio Warner Bros.The parent company of HBO, CNN and the Warner Bros film studio officially put itself up for sale in October after receiving multiple unsolicited offers, setting aside a planned split into two separate entities -- one focused on streaming and studios, the other on traditional cable networks.

content.title: Netflix to buy Warner Bros. Discovery in deal of the decade
content.summary: Streaming giant Netflix said Friday it will buy film and television studio Warner Bros.The parent company of HBO, CNN and the Warner Bros film studio officially put itself up for sale in October after receiving multiple unsolicited offers, setting aside a planned split into two separate entities -- one focused on streaming and studios, the other on traditional cable networks.

thumbnail.caption: The deal is the biggest consolidation in entertainment in more than half a decade (MARIO TAMA)

headline: Netflix to buy Warner Bros Discovery's studios, streaming unit
summary:
STORY: Netflix has agreed to buy Warner Bros Discovery's TV, film studios and streaming division for $72 billion.

The deal would give control of one of Hollywood's most prized and oldest assets to the streaming pioneer.

It follows a weeks-long bidding war in which Netflix offered nearly $28-a-share.

That beat Paramount Skydance's close to $24 bid for the whole of Warner Bros Discovery, including the cable TV assets slated for a spinoff.

Buying the owner of franchises including "Harry Potter", "Game of Thrones" and "DC Comics" will further push the balance of power in Hollywood in favor of Netflix.

And help the streaming giant as it competes with Walt Disney and the Ellison family-led Paramount.

The deal is likely to face strong antitrust scrutiny in Europe and the U.S. though.

As it would give the world's biggest streaming service ownership of a rival that is home to HBO Max and has nearly 130 million streaming subscribers.

Paramount kicked off the bidding war with a series of unsolicited offers.

It has close ties with the Trump administration.

It questioned the sale process earlier this week and alleged favorable treatment to Netflix.

Even before the bids were in, some members of Congress said a Netflix–Warner Bros Discovery deal could harm consumers and Hollywood.

content.title: Netflix to buy Warner Bros Discovery's studios, streaming unit
